comments.body: ive seen this kind of thing on hermitcraft and i'd love to see it available for everyone and it would be really cool overall

I don't see a point in having it in game. It's just like chores fruit. And brewing chorus fruit to get it is pointelss, you all ready have chores fruit. Chorus fruits specialty is that it gives you food resource and it teleports you randomly, this is very effective if you are trapped. I dont see a point making it to potion when potions cant be sttacked into 64 items like chorus fruit does. That would be dissadventige for players. I'm just saying it is pointelss having it in game if its not better than the chorus fruit.
But if you could think more of it, maybe you would get better idea. Like eating chorus fruit is slow, if you throw potion it is way faster Ánd if you throw it on other player, mob or entity it would teleport them, this would be perfect because you could teleport creeper and he would explode some where else. The downside is it will be randomly. Really just think more of it and you will get better idea for it :). Me too, I just think about some idea and want to write it here I have 3 now. The good instructions are: What it can benefit you as a player having this feature.
This feature cant be that overpowered.
Make it unique, not just another list of items or mobs that don't do anything special.
la potion peut nous téléporté a notre base
Then you can make a SPLASH POTION

Perhaps, when in its drinkable form, the teleportation potion will make it so that when you move forward, it will teleport you a few blocks, but not into mid-air. This would enable larger jumps over nothingness.
But if we go with the chorus fruit version, the others have a point. It's not necessarily all about drinking it... but much better PvP! You could teleport them, disorient, or put them in a dangerous situation. The uses for drinkable could be a bit further range of teleportation than chorus fruit by itself, allowing better teleportation into secret bunkers without having to update the chorus fruit itself.
The potion would be a great escape when surrounded by monsters and low health. Throw it down as splash, and travel a good distance away to safety!
The lingering version of this could be more like a portal in some ways.

A lot of people are saying it's just chorus fruit on potion form, but this means you can make splash potions for group teleporting(maybe to the same spot?), lingering potions(for traps), and arrows(Cuz arrows)!
Interesting
Hola
I like that but can we still at least light a TNT Block using Flint and Steel?

*The percentage of area doesn't have to be 1:1, so for example having only 50% of the beacon base be netherite could result in 100% of the area of effect preventing mob spawning.

Personally, I would prefer lower numbers like 33% or 25% for this value since a full beacon made from netherite isn't something everyone will have the time to construct in order to have access to this full-beacon-radius mob proofing hypothetical feature

I really hope for the developers to see this idea because it is REALLY good and REALLY needed

Im over here trying to build a base in the nether and its downright impossible with creepers 2.0 (Ghast). I like to use snow in my builds and Ghasts do serious damage to the builds i try to make, and whats worst is i want to live in the soul sand valley where the Ghast unfortunatly like to party at

But this idea right here, words cannot describe how happy id be to have it, and i mean that really. Its a marvelous idea, you have my vote all the way

This would add a bit more excitement to mining. you could never know what kind of fossil you might find! This would be great if it was sort of a collectible item. It should have about the same spawn rate of netherite but it wouldn't spawn in veins. They could also be sold to villagers for a low price. There should be many to collect, maybe 20-50 types of fossil. They could spawn only one per chunk and at any level underground, but there wouldn't be one in every chunk. Maybe like one in every ten chunks. This seems like a very good suggestion to add to the game, and in my opinion, should definitely be added to the game.

Perfect idea! I had this myself, so I'm glad to see it's already posted. Minecraft doesn't have fossils in the game, it has buried skeletons. They need these!

I like pokemonman07's point about them becoming collectible items. I'm imagining having a personal museum of fossil rocks behind glass. I have this to add:

  • Fossils should be sorted by depth, like ores (e.g., trilobites at 0–30, ferns 30–256, bivalves 50–256, stromatolites 0–256)
  • This is an opportunity for Mojang to draw up freaky new Cambrianesque lifeforms!
  • (If they're permineralized fossils, I don't think they'd have coal in them, but I could be wrong. Wouldn't the coal just catch fire in the furnace tho?)
  • They shouldn't occur in the igneous rocks (granite, diorite, andesite, basalt) but SANDSTONE & TERRACOTTA YESSSS

they would spawn more often in the deserts and most often in the badlands.

one reason for the coal is because the fossil structures spawn with coal replacing some of the bone.
Pretty sure that called concrete powder

411007676492 the thing with concrete powder is, that it turns into solid concrete when coming in contact with water. I would find it neat if we could do colorful beaches without the concrete powder turning into concrete.

An alternative would be mixing concrete powder with charcoal to make the concrete powder hydrophobic, so it doesn't turn solid.

I like the alternative idea, mixing with charcoal, better.  I think it would be weird to add a new colored block that looks the same as concrete powder, I think instead we should just make it waterproof.
Waxed Concrete Powder that prevents it from turning solid upon contact.
Good idea right?...
it would be cool if the enchantments for these added extra damage to the tools you used, or made mining much faster. maybe a grappling enchantment could even be added

I have a second idea on how the birch sap could be collected, you put a bamboo stick in the birch tree (not place it there sideways, like in there a little smaller and tilted a little lower) and then attach a bottle under it with string,

so you use it like, put the bamboo stick, put the string and then put the bottle, and wait it to collect there.
We need this in the 2025 summer drop!
The trident should also have fire aspect and have more durability.
Velmi dobrý nápad

a way to get scuba gear would be in underwater caves is finding liitle huts that contain the scuba gear you would have bigger tanks that allow more air to stay nder water for longer a way to make them brake would be if they have durability or have certain amount of oxygen in them with that you couls alo make them refilable in what way you want
I really like this idea but how would you craft the minor helmet and instead of having all damage been takin away it could just be halfing the damage
You do know Impaling only effects underwater mobs, right?

I love the idea, I actually had the exact same idea myself, down to the crafting recipe, but even though it would do less damage than the trident, I still think it would be too cheap for Mojang's taste.  There's a reason that the trident isn't craftable, and I assume that's because Mojang doesn't want players to have access to a melee and ranged weapon without having to work for it.  Then again, my guess is as good as yours, so I'll vote for it in the hope that Mojang will listen.
Perhaps gold and netherite scraps can repair, but they are not as good as a netherite ingot
MENDING
Great, but this very niche, as fishing rods already allow fishing. Why not extend the affect to all mobs killed?

me gusta la idea ademas el end debe tener actualizaciones y cosas como minerales

 

[I like the idea also the end must have updates and things like minerals] - translated by admin

Hello, this appears to be a non-English post. Below you will find a transcription of the topic being discussed.

Title: “New mineral for the End: Corrupted Platinum”

Text: “It would have a color equal to rose gold and when mining it it would give us a small nugget that when putting 9 together would give us an ingot that in turn you would have to put it on the blacksmith table with a diamond tool or armor (the fortune enchantment would not affect it, it would always give a nugget) this metal would give us several qualities, the first would be not to die from a vacuum since when falling it would teleport us to a nearby island, this ability would depend on how many pieces of armor you wear, The more you have, the greater the teleportation range and any item with this metal would be immune to vacuum, the second ability would consist of teleporting the enemies a few blocks away from us when they hit us as a defense method, it would also depend on how many pieces of armor we have to have a greater or lesser effect, in addition to giving us more durability, attack damage and protection.”

- Translated by Admin
Ripes should only be attachable to hooks. Tripwire hooks could be made to attach to any surface

If you have enough ropes to reach a hook, you can click on the hook and the ropes will attach you to it like a lead. If you push shift and move away from the hook it would extend the rope, if you push shift and stand still you would pick up any slack, and if you push shift and move towards the hook you would pick up the rope
I thought it would be interesting if you could press "Q" and drop a coil of rope as a falling block. If attached to a hook the block would fall and get shorter as it uncoils

Ropes (and possibly chains) may be able to be crafted into a coil, which would have a hole in the center like cauldrons or composters. There would be different layers like snow, which would represent how much rope is in the block. Ropes would also be able to be connected to this block

Dispensers could also dispense ropes. I think when activated they extend and when off they retract. They may stop extending rope if the rope hits a block, although extra rope could just form a coil on the ground

I had the idea that droppers would drop all of the ropes at once in the form of a coil, which may fall faster than extending ropes. Droppers may just drop rope items, but if they are facing a hook they may attach the ropes to it and then drop it has a falling block
Ropes may be attached to blocks to make them entities that can swing. They may break physics a bit as I don't think they would tilt very much, otherwise they could be used to make sideways blocks
When ropes are mined they should fray. They may be broken instantly by swords and axes
Pulleys may be added, although they could just be repurposed grindstones. Alternatively, hooks could just be used to alter the ropes direction

Actually, when ropes are attached to hooks by simply clicking they should just attach the rope to the hook but not to the player. Continuously clicking the rope would make the rope longer. Shift clicking a hook would be what attaches the rope to both the hook and the player

TBH, I'm not sure how players would be able to attach and detach themselves to the rope. I think that shift should be used to un/wind rope and slide down it, and space would be used to ascend hanging rope. Clicking could be used to attach youself, but I still don't know about detaching yourself
I was thinking that perhaps the forward and backwards keys could be used for going uo and down, but I also wanted those keys to be used to make the rope sway.
To make crates a more unique block, they may be the only container that is able to be transported by rope

There should be a Rope and Arrow item, with the arrow acting as a hook. It would attach itself to the player when shot and take rope items to extend itself. If it runs out of rope before it hits something it woulf just detach itself from the player

Kinda niche but I imagine that swinging from ropes would give sculk sensors the same redstone signal as mobs flying or flapping or whatever (wind rushing, basically). However, I don't think they would trigger sculk sensors when they are being extended or retracted
Tripwire hooks may emit a signal on how heavy an item attached to the rope is

Imagine creating a rope elevator using a dispenser that extends rope and another that picks it up, and then transfers the rope to the bottom to reuse. Could also be used to make a conveying system using crates
Knots in ropes may be where ropes are cut and then mended
As lavender is said to have calming properties, it could de-aggro aggravated neutral mobs such as spiders, iron golems, and endermen
Thank you again cranzag for an improvement on my idea
Plant-logging would look cool on a bunch of things
I would like to see mangled rails at the end of mineshafts that can send minecarts flying in random directions and/or damage/break the minecart

I am drewatamnh, just on alt. A friend gave me an idea where some rusty rails spawn automatically and if you pick the up, craft them with sand(to get off the rust) and an iron ingot, it will make a normal rail
You could also place moss carpets on rails. The rail will look mossy and run-down further.
There could be enchantments for hoes that determines whether or not tilled soil grows crops faster
Lets make these materials not so useless
The name is a bit unoriginal
This seems like an entire rip off of netherite but I would like to see a more that comes from the end
You would have to choose what to upgrade your diamond to netherite or enderite (mabye enderite could float in the void to y 60
funny how i was thinking a diamond looking version on enderite. but purple and used to fulfill ur idea, but i would think on mining it instead. but u kool with ur idea XD.
I wouldn't have milk bottles, and I wouldn't have milk be able to be placed on the ground. Instead, it should be put in a cauldron and be allowed to turn into cheese

I do like the idea of cows not being able to be constantly milked. Mooshrooms should be the same with mushroom stew. Like sheep, they should also have the ability to be milked by putting buckets or bowls into a dispenser. The one problem I see is that, unlike sheep, you would be unable to tell when a mooshroom/cow has been milked or not
And I thought this was going to be about putting ice around a bucket of milk to make ice cream.
I totally agree. We could also make somehow butter, cream and yogurts.

Kids want an option for Transformer armor. It can transform into different machinery like a car for example. It is crafted by special ores called diamond iron, super diamonds, and diamond wool and a special crafting table. It is fun to play with and can destroy any mobs.
This would be very funny, but I think, that the developers won't add these things. I would ask modders instead.
Maybe for an April fools update?
Sounds like something straight out of a mod. Besides, it's really over powered and unbalanced. Is this skyrim with the Wabbajack or Minecraft?
